Odeinoichus,"2016-08-01T23:00:47.623Z","Disapointing Lizard.","

Set #7804 Lizard: Another animal in LEGO form from a Creator Polybag, released in 2009 this set was made available with the Daily Mail in the UK, if it was released outside of the UK I’m not sure of, but recently I managed to add it to my collection through a local seller. Is this set worth picking up? Read on to find out.

column2: Design of model impresses in capturing the likeness of a lizard.
Green plates and some bricks used in build makes this a decent parts pack for green parts.
Model is thin and not very bulky. Also could benefit from SNOT techniques.
Piece count also suffers. May have benefited from a few extra parts for the tail to make the model slightly longer.

column1: It’s difficult to say sometimes if a Polybag is worth tracking down years after missing the first opportunity to get it. I think in the case of this particular Polybag it isn’t really worth that extra mile, if you happen to stumble across it you might find an interest in it, especially if you are a fan of Creator based sets. The animal design is limited in this small scale so unless you are a huge fan you may not like it. Especially as none of these sets include Minifigures.
You can safely skip this one, you definitely won’t miss much for not picking it up.
